sub_topic: Prove that the empty set is a subset of every set.
message_1: Let set A = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5}. Is the empty set, Ø, a subset of set A? Prove your answer using the definition of a subset.
message_2:
Yes, the empty set Ø is a subset of set A.

By definition, a set B is a subset of a set A (denoted as B ⊆ A) if every element of B is also an element of A. In other words, if x is an element of B, then x must also be an element of A.

The empty set Ø has no elements. Therefore, there are no elements in Ø that are not in A. Since there are no elements in Ø that contradict the definition of a subset, we can conclude that the empty set Ø is a subset of set A.

In general, the empty set is a subset of any set, as it always satisfies the definition of a subset.
